317 to 331 Canal Street, north side, east of, adjoining, and at the east corner of Greene Street, which begins here.
1928.
P. L. Sperr.

718035f-b.text:
Canal Street, south side, west from Church Street, to West Broadway (8th Avenue "E1" thereon). No. 1 is southwestward from Canal and Greene Streets and shows the easterly portion of this block and upon which in November 1938 will rise a new ~.0. Station. This is the present west side of Church Street, from Canal to Lispenard Streets after widening. South of the latter point is the New York Telephone Building. V9ew No. 2 is southward down Wooster Street and shows No's. EN(8 to 3A8. These are included in the demolition for the afoSe.
entioner P.O. site.
V1ew To.3 is extensive and shows the entire block front exclusive of the corner structure at Church Street (left).
June 23, 1933.
Views 1,2 and 3
P.L. Sperr
